commit_message:
Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

Release notes were taken from a follow-up change [2].

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/a/2626364/6265131
[2]: I9b9eb3158b099cf04d788692fc9e5efcdfebf93e

Change-Id: I4c218793948b0ed7ce0c143d6c794516fdeb224f
(cherry picked from commit ff6d0c5280fbdbe8f5361469fb88448fa650f365)
(cherry picked from commit 2cb52fe60abd3f073daebc1eafda0394c70d8814)
(cherry picked from commit 9ed984f861ee0a868f34d2f0fd0942017d55ade9)

commit_message:
Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

Release notes were taken from a follow-up change [2].

subject: Improve string representation of DB models
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-27 08:37:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/bc95e34819bed67444c752e59c01a90c0c6df89b', 'message': 'Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/a/2626364/6265131

commit_message:
Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

Release notes were taken from a follow-up change [2].

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/a/2626364/6265131
[2]: I9b9eb3158b099cf04d788692fc9e5efcdfebf93e

commit_message:
Add *.orig to .gitignore

.orig files get generated by Git when a merge conflict happens. Nobody
should ever want to add those files to the Git tree. By including them
in .gitignore we prevent that those files get added by accident.

 Conflicts:
	.gitignore

commit_message:
Strict minimum bandwidth support for tunnelled networks

The aim of the RFE is to improve the previous implemented RFE
Strict minimum bandwidth support [1].

[1]https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1578989

Related-Bug: #1991965
Change-Id: I21a1d9bee1d195f704a518ea3dbd3f2b1e35a357
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/59/860859/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================= Strict minimum bandwidth support for tunnelled networks ======================================================= Launchpad bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1991965 The aim of the RFE is to improve the previous implemented RFE Strict minimum bandwidth support [1]_. Problem Description =================== Since [1]_, Neutron has the ability to model the available bandwidth of the physical interfaces (ingress and egress) connected to the physical networks (flat and VLAN networks). This information is collected by Placement and used to spawn virtual machines with network ports on compute nodes with enough bandwidth. That guarantees a minimum port throughput. This feature is currently implemented in three backends: ML2/SR-IOV, ML2/OVS and ML2/OVN. The full list of related patches can be reviewed at [2]_. However, most of the current deployments do not use physical backed networks (flat or VLAN) but overlay networs (VXLAN and Geneve). Of course those deployments use ML2/OVS and ML2/OVN; ML2/SR-IOV does not support tunnelled networks. That leads to an existing gap in the currently implemented feature: there is no way to model tunnelled networks. Proposed Change =============== This RFE proposes a way to model the available bandwidth for tunnelled networks in compute nodes. This implementation will be limited to ML2/OVS and ML2/OVN backends. The referred backends handle the overlay traffic sending and receiving this traffic from a host interface, that acts as a VTEP [3]_. This host interface is identified by an IP address, known as "local_ip" in the ML2 plugin configuration file [4]_. This RFE proposes to use the same configuration options provided in [1]_, adding a static string constant to define a tunnelled network, "rp_tunnelled". For example:: [ovs] resource_provider_bandwidths = br0:EGRESS:INGRESS,rp_tunnelled:EGRESS:INGRESS resource_provider_hypervisors = br0:compute2,rp_tunnelled:compute1 This new string constant cannot be used as a physical bridge name. To avoid any possible clash, there will be a new check when parsing the physical network bridge mappings. A host with ML2/OVN backend with a physical network (mapped to the physical bridge "br-ex") and a tunnelled network will report the following resource provider tree:: $ openstack resource provider list +--------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+------------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | uuid | name | generation | root_provider_uuid | parent_provider_uuid | +--------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+------------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | 8f0e060d-bf63-42a1-85e6-710c8b2fccc8 | u20ovn | 10 | 8f0e060d-bf63-42a1-85e6-710c8b2fccc8 | None | | cb101b60-527b-5264-8e7f-213c7b88e9e1 | u20ovn:OVN Controller agent | 1 | 8f0e060d-bf63-42a1-85e6-710c8b2fccc8 | 8f0e060d-bf63-42a1-85e6-710c8b2fccc8 | | 521f53a6-c8c0-583c-98da-7a47f39ff887 | u20ovn:OVN Controller agent:br-ex | 20 | 8f0e060d-bf63-42a1-85e6-710c8b2fccc8 | cb101b60-527b-5264-8e7f-213c7b88e9e1 | | dfdbf43f-f60b-577c-bae8-3dcea448c735 | u20ovn:OVN Controller agent:rp_tunnelled | 6 | 8f0e060d-bf63-42a1-85e6-710c8b2fccc8 | cb101b60-527b-5264-8e7f-213c7b88e9e1 | +--------------------------------------+------------------------------------------+------------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ A new static trait is added to this resource provider: "CUSTOM_TUNNELLED_NETWORKS". This is what identify that this resource provider is for tunnelled networks. E.g.:: $ openstack resource provider trait list $rp_tun +----------------------------------+ | name | +----------------------------------+ | CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_NORMAL | | CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT | | CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT_PHYSICAL | | CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_MACVTAP | | CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_VDPA | | CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_REMOTE_MANAGED | | CUSTOM_VNIC_TYPE_BAREMETAL | | CUSTOM_TUNNELLED_NETWORKS | +----------------------------------+ REST API Impact --------------- This RFE does not introduce any API change. Data Model Impact ----------------- This RFE does not introduce any model change. Security Impact --------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other Impact ------------ (talk about current ports in tunnelled networks with min-QoS) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignees: Rodolfo Alonso Hernandez <ralonsoh@redhat.com> (IRC: ralonsoh) Work Items ---------- * ML2 plugin update. * Documentation. * Tests and CI related changes. Testing ======= * Unit/functional Tests. * Tempest tests. Documentation Impact ==================== User Documentation ------------------ Ammend the "Strict minimum bandwidth support" [1]_ documentation, adding this new improvement. References ========== .. [1] [RFE] Strict minimum bandwidth support (egress) https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1578989 .. [2] https://review.opendev.org/q/%25231578989 .. [3] https://networklessons.com/cisco/ccnp-encor-350-401/introduction-to-virtual-extensible-lan-vxlan .. [4] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/599c81767ea7aa3bde7a64ff57b20f34fb314548/neutron/conf/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovs_conf.py#L44-L50

commit_message:
Add *.orig to .gitignore

.orig files get generated by Git when a merge conflict happens. Nobody
should ever want to add those files to the Git tree. By including them
in .gitignore we prevent that those files get added by accident.

commit_message:
Check for KeyError when looking for remote data

Accessing relation data during departed or broken
events results in KeyError from ops framework.

KeyError: 'Cannot index relation data with "None".
Are you trying to access remote app data during a
relation-broken event? This is not allowed.'

Add KeyError whenever remote data is accessed.

Change-Id: I4b6e044eb3d5810ecd75fe666871478bd4c826fb

commit_message:
Fix delete_routes_from_table

oslo.service crashed with error "TypeError: cannot serialize
'Record' object" when
ovn_bgp_agent.privileged.linux_net.route_delete(route) is called
like this. Called via delete_ip_routes() which uses only part of
the route's information, works.

Change-Id: Ic76131b2cadb5b5b67001edf1f7f8976e67500ea

commit_message:
Update status on remove-relation

Handle the events when relation is
removed and update the status accordingly.
In this patch Ingress, RabbitMQ,
IdentityService, CloudCredentials are handled.

Change-Id: I76a1a930a3ef4eebc8b0ffd9c154c5a6ecfb93e0

Last release of OSA Wallaby

PR that was goal for this bugfix release was proposed before coordinated
EM of Wallaby across projects but we couldn't merge it in time due to
different reasons. So I want to still release it as bugfix release
before EM-ing it.

Change-Id: Icf000bd01c3a95f69fc893dcd51fb595d31182cd

commit_message:
Ensure cleanup upon router removal without gateway unset

If the router is removed without unsetting the gateway fist,
there are errors due to information retrival for the router
datapath failing, since it has already been deleted.

This patch makes sure that information is accesible (in memory
copy) so that subnet removal is properly done in those cases.

Note this issue could also happen in busy environments where both
commands (gateway unset + router removal, or subnet detach from
router + router removal) are executed one after another.

Change-Id: I144aac847b533ed759a8956feb58ae9983d59bd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-bgp-agent refs/changes/84/864284/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _remove_network_exposed(self, subnet_cidr, gateway): subnet_ip = subnet_cidr.split('/')[0] for subnet_logical_port in gateway['subnets_datapath'].keys(): if subnet_logical_port in self.ovn_local_lrps.keys(): self.ovn_local_lrps.pop(subnet_logical_port) linux_net.del_ip_rule( subnet_cidr, self.ovn_routing_tables[gateway['bridge_device']], gateway['bridge_device']) subnet_ip_version = linux_net.get_ip_version(subnet_cidr) for gateway_ip in gateway_ips: if linux_net.get_ip_version(gateway_ip) == subnet_ip_version: subnet_ip, self.ovn_routing_tables[gateway['bridge_device']], gateway['bridge_device'], vlan=gateway['bridge_vlan'], mask=subnet_ip.split("/")[1], net = ipaddress.IPv6Network(subnet_ip, strict=False) else: net = ipaddress.IPv4Network(subnet_ip, strict=False) 'subnets_cidr': [], try: subnet_cidr = lrp.mac.split(" ")[1] except KeyError: # This should not happen: subnet without CIDR subnet_cidr = None if subnet_cidr: self.ovn_local_cr_lrps[row.logical_port][ 'subnets_cidr'].append(subnet_cidr) # and if so delete the needed routes/rules local_cr_lrp_info = self.ovn_local_cr_lrps.get(row.logical_port) for subnet_cidr in local_cr_lrp_info['subnets_cidr']: self.remove_network_exposed(subnet_cidr, local_cr_lrp_info) # check if there are loadbalancers associated to the router, # and if so delete the needed routes/rules try: cr_lrp = self.sb_idl.is_router_gateway_on_chassis(row.datapath, self.chassis) except ValueError: # NOTE(ltomasbo): This happens when the router (datapath) gets # deleted at the same time as subnets are detached from it. # Usually this will be hit when router is deleted without # removing its gateway. In that case we don't need to withdraw # the subnet as it is not exposed, just the cr-lrp which is # handle in a different event/method (withdraw_ip) LOG.debug("Router is being deleted, so it's datapath does not " "exists any more. Checking if port belongs to chassis " "redirect and skip in that case.") cr_lrp = [cr_lrp_name for cr_lrp_name in self.ovn_local_cr_lrps.keys() if row.logical_port in cr_lrp_name] # if cr_lrp exists, this means the lrp port is for the router # gateway, so there is no need to proceed if cr_lrp: LOG.debug("Port is related to chassis redirect, so there is " "no need to do further actions for subnet " "withdrawal, as this port was not triggering a " "subnet exposure.") return
deleted_lines: def _remove_network_exposed(self, router_port, gateway): try: router_port_ip = router_port.mac[0].split(' ')[1] except IndexError: return router_ip = router_port_ip.split('/')[0] if router_ip in gateway_ips: return if router_port.logical_port in self.ovn_local_lrps.keys(): self.ovn_local_lrps.pop(router_port.logical_port) bridge_device, bridge_vlan = self._get_bridge_for_datapath( gateway['provider_datapath']) linux_net.del_ip_rule(router_port_ip, self.ovn_routing_tables[bridge_device], bridge_device) router_port_ip_version = linux_net.get_ip_version(router_port_ip) for gateway_ip in gateway_ips: if linux_net.get_ip_version(gateway_ip) == router_port_ip_version: router_ip, self.ovn_routing_tables[bridge_device], bridge_device, vlan=bridge_vlan, mask=router_port_ip.split("/")[1], net = ipaddress.IPv6Network(router_port_ip, strict=False) else: net = ipaddress.IPv4Network(router_port_ip, strict=False) # and if so, delete the needed routes/rules lrp_ports = self.sb_idl.get_lrp_ports_for_router(row.datapath) for lrp in lrp_ports: if (lrp.chassis or not lrp.logical_port.startswith('lrp-') or "chassis-redirect-port" in lrp.options.keys()): continue local_cr_lrp_info = self.ovn_local_cr_lrps.get( row.logical_port) if local_cr_lrp_info: self._remove_network_exposed(lrp, local_cr_lrp_info) cr_lrp = self.sb_idl.is_router_gateway_on_chassis(row.datapath, self.chassis)

commit_message:
Add yaml files for tap-as-a-service

As tap-as-a-service was under x/ namespace for several cycles we miss
yaml files for some of its branches and tags.
This patch adds these files for
* queens (with EOL tag)
* rocky  (with EOL tag)
* stein  (with EOL tag)

With these yaml files in place the later management of taas versions and
tags  will be easier I hope.

Change-Id: I4df60f91427af12926e2043efa2c4a19dbbfbe1e

commit_message:
update container status once service is ready

Currently the container handler status is updated
only when update_status hook is triggered.
Update the status once the service is ready instead
of waiting for update_status hook.

Change-Id: I52cf06af03dd1807ee0097d7dd7fb8bc85e13781

commit_message:
Release python-novaclient 18.2.0

The nova supports microversions 2.93 in the Zed release.
However the support for microversions 2.93 has not been included
in the python-novaclient 18.1.0 (the Zed release).

Add support for microversions 2.93 in the 18.2.0.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 18.1.0..2af1d0c5
2af1d0c5 Remove unnecessary testing code
d4ea897b Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name
f50bcbc4 Update master for stable/zed
94d3445e MV 2.93 - Add support to rebuild boot volume

Change-Id: Ib21f7b860764f685a9fd152e8432363bc6d696bf
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Check for KeyError when looking for remote data

Accessing relation data during departed or broken
events results in KeyError from ops framework.

KeyError: 'Cannot index relation data with "None".
Are you trying to access remote app data during a
relation-broken event? This is not allowed.'

Add KeyError whenever remote data is accessed.

Change-Id: I8515ed584caee7304b091b3e57d83c660ac5b296

commit_message:
Expand boot device choice

Currently, ironicclient accepts pxe, disk, cdrom, bios, safe and wanboot
as boot device but not iscsiboot. However ilo driver supports iscsiboot
as boot device.
If user run 'openstack baremetal node boot device set' with iscsiboot,
command doesn't allow iscsiboot be set.

So this commit expands acceptable boot device list with addition of
iscsiboot.

Story: 2010438
Task: 46860
Change-Id: I9307607db9d01e4763336a0be8108bc23f9effaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/47/864847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BOOT_DEVICES = ['pxe', 'disk', 'cdrom', 'bios', 'safe', 'wanboot', 'iscsiboot']

commit_message:
Update return value to be a valid UUID

When creating vGPU instances with Nvidia Tesla A40,
"ValueError: badly formed hexadecimal UUID string" error occurred
by a return value of mdev_name2uuid function.
The value has UUID value and PCI address.
Remove PCI address part of a return value
as using a string slicing function.

Example of a return value:
Before: 5da919f7-1ffc-405e-832c-71686f8c2862-0000-ca-01-2
After: 5da919f7-1ffc-405e-832c-71686f8c2862

Change-Id: Iad0358b8062aa660423fcc9f8414cae821c857e3

commit_message:
[Train and before] Run requirement check job on Focal

stable/train and older branches need support for Python 2. However,
Ubuntu Jammy does not ship python 2 and the job consistently fails
because it can't install python 2 packages. This change switches back
the job for stable/train from Jammy to Focal.

Change-Id: I410886ae84cdb4a0d0f35b89a54fa2b0028030d0

commit_message:
Nova: Start nova-compute after its NFS backend is ready

When Nova NFS backend is enabled, all instance data is stored in
the NFS storage, and the storage access should be ready when
the nova-compute service is started.

That's the one which fixes possible wrong permissions in /var/lib/nova/
issues by enforcing that ordering by additional systemd service
dependency.

Note: nova_statedir_owner is a one-off init container executed in
step_3, while NFS mounts are created earlier by the host prep tasks.
Here everything is set properly and needs no explicit dependencies.

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Related: rhbz#2041360
Closes-Bug: #1977992
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/845046
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/849007
Change-Id: I88f2b849a846a67088b9055faa4747f22b583580
(cherry picked from commit 728d2ad43394802cadc97d90915c63da231f1dcf)

commit_message:
Update docs for CentOS9

We still suggest installing on CentOS 8 Stream. This wouldn't be
expected to work as we have moved to CentOS Stream 9 (aka. CentOS 9)
for master now. This patch updates our install guide for CentOS 9.

Note that there are still remaining reference to CentOS 8 Stream, but
this change aims to fix what we can fix easily now.

Change-Id: Icb8c584e1a62278ca2d8239a83f603c2e90ec03a

commit_message:
Do not use --debug for image build

Since Ansible was bumped to 2.14, we've observed the container image
build process gets stuck in the middle of ansible tasks to generate
Docker/Buildah files. We've not yet identified the actual problem but
some debug attempt revealed that the verbosity of playbook execution is
triggering the issue.

This removes --debug option from the command as a temporal workaround.

Related-Bug: #1996612
Change-Id: Iecd7d45376752430b9c23d858b3f7a3dd34a862d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/03/864803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(tkajinam): With Ansible 2.14, the playbook triggered by the command gets # stuck if -vvv is set. We temporarily remove --debug as # a workaround until we find out the appropriate fix. # --debug

commit_message:
Element enable-services addition.

This is a new element to allow enabling arbitrary services in the
resulting disk image. It works by using the DIB_ENABLE_SERVICES
environment variable, which is a space-separated list of services
to enable during the post-install.d phase.

This is good for Gentoo only currently, with systemd service units
and openrc services in the default runlevel.

Change-Id: Ib3ff817288863e641fa15a70f30a558b099adb59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/84/848984/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========== enable-services ========== Enables services inside the generated cloud image. Currently only supports Gentoo, and only OpenRC's default runlevel, as well as only systemd service units. Environment Variables --------------------- DIB_ENABLE_SERVICES: :Required: No :Default: Empty :Description: Enables services post-install for the generated cloud image. :Example: DIB_ENABLE_SERVICES="systemd-networkd systemd-resolved"

commit_message:
Remove usage of glanceclient

... because Glance was already removed from Undercloud. This also
removes the module and the playbook which require glanceclient because
these are useless. Note that the playbook removed by this change is
not actually used by tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I7b482e5a03878baf42ef2c2c72bbdb0637cb204d
(cherry picked from commit 2c7ad264541fc8340890443af19a0c3d3dabbaf1)

Remove usage of swiftclient

... because Swift was removed from undercloud.

Change-Id: I16ec686d632723a5cb8b1580240b8a5195e9a4e2

deleted_lines: from swiftclient import client as swift_client def get_object_client(self): """Return the object (swift) client. This method will return a client object using the legacy library. Upon the creation of a successful client creation, the client object will be stored in the `self.client_cache object`, should this method be called more than once, the cached object will automatically return, resulting in fewer authentications and faster API interactions. :returns: Object """ if 'swift_client' in self.client_cache: return self.client_cache['swift_client'] else: self.client_cache['swift_client'] = swift_client.Connection( session=self.sess, retries=10, starting_backoff=3, max_backoff=120 ) return self.client_cache['swift_client']

commit_message:
container-puppet.sh idempotency on restart

When restarting a container-puppet-{service} container,
make sure to remove /etc/puppet from its storage,
otherwise the config generation might fail, for example
when using upload-puppet-module with a stack update.

Change-Id: I1ff3363259397bba60f5ec09086cb7de34e7af8b
Closes-Bug: #1940571
(cherry picked from commit 2e4361c878556979569a886db69b97bacf00fa29)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/45/864045/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rm -rf /etc/puppet

commit_message:
Allow for jinja2 templating of docker_config

In support of the wider Multi-RHEL effort. We will
need to support templating to allow for Ansible to
determine which container needs to be pulled to
the hosts based on their OS version.

This change adds support for that templating of
the docker_config files.

Change-Id: Id56a4670507524f41fde238887fce4dd19e90a87
(cherry picked from commit 3d40e77a66eb7121a20d59c65788c89fccbd2ca2)

deleted_lines: loop: "{{ lookup('file', tripleo_role_name + '/docker_config.yaml', errors='ignore') | default('{}', True) | from_yaml | recursive_get_key_from_dict(key='image') | unique }}"

commit_message:
Octavia: Accept lists for Ciphers parameters

This is follow-up of 875155550959d112acc37f74d88a674fca640167 and
allows usage of list values for ciphers parameters so that users can
more easily maintain items. List values are automatically converted to
colon-separated strings by puppet-octavia .

Also, some default values are quite long and makes maintenance quite
difficult. Instead of hard-coding default, these parameters use service
default when the values are unset(or intentionally set to empty lists).

Conflicts:
	deployment/octavia/octavia-api-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I09ca5baff60f472edee0a4bde59f9c2e575dfdee
(cherry picked from commit fef8dacd9fc394f01df5a2a202938f672bbd43ef)

commit_message:
[WIP] All-in-one OSH deployment into a VM

Script designed to deployment of OSH stack onto an all-in-one node,
either on an existing envrionment or into a target VM.

Change-Id: Id2748c0098a592c9ab9edf313466015c37577776
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/17/830517/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Deploy OpenStack Helm in a target VM or local environment. set -ex if [[ $UID != 0 ]]; then echo Script must be run as root, exiting. exit 1 fi SOURCE="${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" while [ -h "$SOURCE" ]; do # resolve $SOURCE until the file is no longer a symlink DIR="$( cd -P "$( dirname "$SOURCE" )" >/dev/null 2>&1 && pwd )" SOURCE="$(readlink "$SOURCE")" [[ $SOURCE != /* ]] && SOURCE="$DIR/$SOURCE" # if $SOURCE was a relative symlink, we need to resolve it relative to the path where the symlink file was located done BASEDIR="$( cd -P "$( dirname "$SOURCE" )" >/dev/null 2>&1 && pwd )" cd "${BASEDIR}" install_pkg(){ dpkg -l $1 2> /dev/null | grep ^ii > /dev/null || sudo -E apt-get -y install $1 } # Update apt cache if needed if [ ! -f /var/lib/apt/periodic/update-success-stamp ] || \ sudo find /var/lib/apt/periodic/update-success-stamp -mtime +1 | grep update-success-stamp; then sudo -E apt -y update fi # Install pre-requisites install_pkg qemu-kvm install_pkg virtinst install_pkg libvirt-daemon-system install_pkg libvirt-clients install_pkg cloud-image-utils install_pkg util-linux # Deploy to local VM : ${USE_VM:=true} # Remove / destroy last VM before creating a new one : ${CLEAN_VM:=true} # OpenStack release : ${OS_RELEASE:=Victoria} # Target environment ubuntu version : ${UBUNTU_VERSION:=bionic} # Path to your SSH private key : ${SSH_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH:=~/.ssh/id_rsa} # Path to your SSH public key : ${SSH_PUBLIC_KEY_PATH:=~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub} if [[ $USE_VM = true ]]; then TARGET_IMG_URL="https://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/$UBUNTU_VERSION/current/$UBUNTU_VERSION-server-cloudimg-amd64.img" img_path="$BASEDIR/$(basename $TARGET_IMG_URL)" img_path_backup="${img_path}.orig" if [[ $CLEAN_VM = true ]]; then virsh destroy $OS_RELEASE >& /dev/null || true virsh undefine $OS_RELEASE >& /dev/null || true if [[ -f $img_path_backup ]]; then # Replace image with original cp "${img_path_backup}" "${img_path}" fi fi echo VM image path: $img_path if [[ ! -f "${img_path}" ]]; then echo Downloading focal VM image wget "$TARGET_IMG_URL" # Extend image qemu-img resize "$img_path" +100G # Store the original for re-use later cp "${img_path}" "${img_path_backup}" fi cloud_init_config_dir="${BASEDIR}/cloud-init" mkdir -p "${cloud_init_config_dir}" # Seed image meta-data echo '{"hostname": "gatestack", "name": "gatestack", "uuid": "97394254-270a-405a-b052-1e8be05a8cf3"}' > "${cloud_init_config_dir}/meta_data.json" # Seed image network config echo 'version: 2 ethernets: all-en: match: name: "en*" dhcp4: true' > "${cloud_init_config_dir}/network_data.json" # Seed image ssh keys echo "#cloud-config users: - name: root lock_passwd: false # password login: root/secret hashed_passwd: \$1\$SaltSalt\$YhgRYajLPrYevs14poKBQ0 ssh_authorized_keys: - $(cat $SSH_PUBLIC_KEY_PATH) hostname: gatestack ssh_pwauth: True password: secret chpasswd: expire: false list: | root:secret ubuntu:secret users: - default - name: root gecos: password ssh_pwauth: True ssh_authorized_keys: - $(cat $SSH_PUBLIC_KEY_PATH)" > "${cloud_init_config_dir}/user_data" cloud_config_iso_path="${BASEDIR}/$(basename $img_path)_config.iso" cloud-localds -v --network-config="${cloud_init_config_dir}/network_data.json" "${cloud_config_iso_path}" "${cloud_init_config_dir}/user_data" "${cloud_init_config_dir}/meta_data.json" # enable ipv4 forwarding sysctl net.ipv4.ip_forward=1 # allow nested virtualization modprobe kvm-intel nested=Y; modprobe kvm-amd nested=1 echo Creating VM domain mac='52:54:00:6c:99:85' virsh dominfo "${OS_RELEASE}" >& /dev/null || \ virt-install \ --connect qemu:///system \ --name $OS_RELEASE \ --memory 57344 \ --cpu host-passthrough \ --vcpus 12 \ --import \ --disk path="${img_path}" \ --disk path="${cloud_config_iso_path},device=cdrom" \ --noautoconsole \ --graphics vnc,listen=0.0.0.0 \ --os-variant ubuntu18.04 \ --network network=default,mac=$mac \ --virt-type kvm time_waited=0 timeout=300 while [[ $time_waited -lt $timeout ]]; do ipaddr="$(virsh net-dhcp-leases default | grep -i $mac | tail -1 | awk '{print $5}' | cut -d '/' -f1)" if [[ -n $ipaddr ]]; then if ssh -i $SSH_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH -o "StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -o "UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null" root@$ipaddr date > /dev/null; then echo VM ready to accept SSH connection break fi fi sleep 5 time_waited=$(($time_waited + 5)) done fi cat <<'END' > tgthost_script.sh #!/bin/bash # Disable local nameserver to prevent conflicts with k8s nameserver systemctl stop systemd-resolved systemctl disable systemd-resolved echo 'nameserver 208.67.222.222' > /etc/resolv.conf echo 'nameserver 8.8.8.8' >> /etc/resolv.conf # Set hostname and FQDN hostname gatestack echo 'gatestack' > /etc/hostname if ! grep gatestack /etc/hosts; then #echo '127.0.1.1 gatestack gatestack.openstack.svc.cluster.local' >> /etc/hosts echo '127.0.1.1 gatestack' >> /etc/hosts fi # Update apt cache if needed if [ ! -f /var/lib/apt/periodic/update-success-stamp ] || \ sudo find /var/lib/apt/periodic/update-success-stamp -mtime +1 | grep update-success-stamp; then sudo -E apt -y update fi apt -y install git curl make wget if [[ ! -d openstack-helm-infra ]]; then while ! git clone https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra.git; do echo openstack-helm-infra clone attempt failed, retrying... sleep 10 done fi if [[ ! -d openstack-helm ]]; then while ! git clone https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm.git; do echo openstack-helm clone attempt failed, retrying... sleep 10 done fi # Set release / distro info export OPENSTACK_RELEASE=victoria export CONTAINER_DISTRO_VERSION=focal export OSH_TEST_TIMEOUT=1200 # Replacement for openstack-helm-infra/playbooks/osh-infra-gate-runner.yaml, since it has Zuul-exclusive roles. apt -y install --no-install-recommends \ python3-pip \ libssl-dev \ python3-dev \ build-essential \ jq \ curl pip3 install --upgrade pip pip3 install --upgrade setuptools pip3 install --upgrade cmd2 pip3 install --upgrade pyopenssl pip3 install --upgrade "ansible==2.9" pip3 install --upgrade ara==0.16.5 pip3 install --upgrade yq # Missing package install needed for 170-setup-gateway.sh apt -y install net-tools echo ================RESOLV_CONF_CONTENTS=============== cat /etc/resolv.conf # Start scripts from "openstack-helm-compute-kit" job in openstack-helm repo cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/common/install-packages.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/gate/deploy-k8s.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/common/setup-client.sh; cd ../ if ! type kubectl >& /dev/null; then echo 'kubectl not installed, exiting!' exit 1 fi cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/common/ingress.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/common/rabbitmq.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/common/mariadb.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/common/memcached.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/keystone/keystone.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/heat/heat.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/glance/glance.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/compute-kit/openvswitch.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/compute-kit/libvirt.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/component/compute-kit/compute-kit.sh; cd ../ #cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/common/run-helm-tests.sh neutron; cd ../ #cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/common/run-helm-tests.sh nova; cd ../ #cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/common/run-helm-tests.sh glance; cd ../ #cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/common/run-helm-tests.sh keystone; cd ../ # This script has multiple problems that prevent it from working #cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/developer/common/170-setup-gateway.sh; cd ../ # Test creation of heat stacks cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/developer/common/900-use-it.sh; cd ../ cd openstack-helm; ./tools/deployment/common/force-cronjob-run.sh; cd ../ END chmod 755 tgthost_script.sh if [[ $USE_VM = true ]]; then # Run target script in VM scp -i $SSH_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH -o "StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -o "UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null" tgthost_script.sh root@$ipaddr:~ ssh -i $SSH_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH -o "StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -o "UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null" root@$ipaddr "nohup ~/tgthost_script.sh >& ~/logfile &" ssh -i $SSH_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH -o "StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -o "UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null" root@$ipaddr "tail -f ~/logfile" else # Run target script locally nohup ~/tgthost_script.sh >& ~/logfile & fi

commit_message:
Add new nodepool_provider for ibm cloud

This patch adds a new nodepool provider for "ibm rhcloud". With this
change, the environment config used for BM2 provider will also be used for
BM3 provider[1].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/src/commit/56e6bc85adc03809f07a6f5627b76798a0deef33/roles/ci-common-vars/vars/main.yaml#L60

Testproject: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/46046/

Change-Id: Ia14302ad02245894966229fc7b27d5a7ca74fc5a

commit_message:
Fix error KeyError: 'addresses' for two tests

When we use create_test_server, waiters.wait_for_server_status
returns servers with more details (including server IP address in case
we don't use fip). It is needed successfully execute
wait_for_ssh_or_ping and finally get_server_ip. The last function
(get_server_ip) extract IP adress just from server dict and fails
if there is no adresses dict in it.

Closes-Bug: 1996468
Change-Id: Ib1157f4bb6fe42b3fbcdd3eafac0b5063d1a9e56

commit_message:
Use default Ubuntu Jammy ceph repos

Ubuntu 22.04 does provide Ceph Quincy (17.2.*) out of the box, thus
there's no urgent need to have comunity repos and we can simply rely
on distro-provided ones. We can remove logic once community publish
Ceph packages for Ubuntu Jammy (22.04).

Change-Id: I169971ef77f11ceb01a5db87441051dcb33555f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph refs/changes/24/863524/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ! ${DISTRO} =~ (jammy|focal|bionic|xenial|f31|f32|f33|f34|rhel8|rhel9) ]]; then Please use Ubuntu Xenial, Ubuntu Bionic, Ubuntu Focal, Ubuntu Jammy, Fedora 31-34 or CentOS Stream 8/9." if ! [[ $os_CODENAME =~ (jammy|focal|xenial|bionic) ]]; then # NOTE(noonedeadpunk): There're no community repos for Ubuntu Jammy yet # but Ceph Quincy is provided from default # Ubuntu 22.04 repos. if [[ $os_CODENAME == (jammy) ]]; then configure_repo_ceph "apt-get" "$CEPH_RELEASE" "$os_CODENAME" fi
deleted_lines: if [[ ! ${DISTRO} =~ (focal|bionic|xenial|f31|f32|f33|f34|rhel8) ]]; then Please use Ubuntu Xenial, Ubuntu Bionic, Ubuntu Focal, Fedora 31-34, or CentOS Stream 8." if ! [[ $os_CODENAME =~ (focal|xenial|bionic) ]]; then configure_repo_ceph "apt-get" "$CEPH_RELEASE" "$os_CODENAME"

commit_message:
Reconfigure amphora network interfaces seamlessly

Update amphora-interface app to allow reconfiguration of the network
interfaces without having to set them down first.

IP addresses/routes maintained by keepalived in Active/Standby topology
are now explicitly defined and marked as 'ignored' in the interface
files, allowing amphora-interface to not consider them as unused
addresses.

Add fixed_ips support on the VIP port, enabling the possibility to set
up many ip addresses on the VIP port

Story: 2005608
Task: 30847

Change-Id: If0b211b3ef4fce3b7a58823fc8d1e48448e4d346
(cherry picked from commit 7118e8d56f76a99f19fd0696be3f09b6fb258cb2)
(cherry picked from commit d75613fab2dd15e05cf002142c43797e9d31ffdd)
(cherry picked from commit c513c9e77a13994a91c30abaeb7bb9b56351a295)

commit_message:
Reconfigure amphora network interfaces seamlessly

Update amphora-interface app to allow reconfiguration of the network
interfaces without having to set them down first.

IP addresses/routes maintained by keepalived in Active/Standby topology
are now explicitly defined and marked as 'ignored' in the interface
files, allowing amphora-interface to not consider them as unused
addresses.

Add fixed_ips support on the VIP port, enabling the possibility to set
up many ip addresses on the VIP port

commit_message:
Add NVMe-RoCE Cinder driver support for Pure Storage

From OpenStack Zed the Pure Storage Cinder driver supports
NVMe-RoCE as a dataplane protocol. This patch adds support
for this new driver type.

Also amend a couple of documentation formatting typos.

Change-Id: Ic1eed7d19e9b583e22419625c92ac3507ea4614d

commit_message:
Drop OpenStack governance repos from StoryBoard

The OpenStack TC has not been using StoryBoard for goal task
tracking for many years now, and wants to clean up the presence of
their governance-specific repositories there in order to avoid
future confusion[*]. Remove the use-storyboard option from both
openstack/governance and openstack/election, freeing up the
governance group as well. This can be safely merged at any time,
since it alone won't make any changes to storyboard.openstack.org
(follow up action will be required on the part of an SB admin to
mark the projects inactive and remove their associated group).

[*] https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/tc/2022/tc.2022-11-16-16.00.html

Change-Id: I34d41f495daa06d438b5f4f8329270fe03731bbb

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-11-14 17:52:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ccf6cde90fa929f46efad3443455d5a839e70c61', 'message': '[stable-only] Do not fail making reservation when creating a SG

patch skips the quota check.

done using a new method called "quota_limit_check" [2]. This method
does not fail in the related case.

commit_message:
[stable-only] Do not fail making reservation when creating a SG

Do not fail during the creation of a security group when trying to
make a quota reservation for the security group rules. This feature
was added in [1], in order to prevent the rule quota excess during
the security group creation.

However, as reported in LP#1992161, this method can be called from
the RPC worker. If this RPC worker is spawned alone (not with the API
workers), the extensions are not loaded and the security group rule
quota resources are not created. That means the quota engine does not
have the security group rules as managed resources (in this worker).

When a new network (and the first subnet) is created, the DHCP agent
(or agents) handling this network will try to create the DHCP port.
If, as commented in the LP bug, the default security group is not
created, the RPC worker will try to create it. In this case this
patch skips the quota check.

This patch is for stable releases only. Since Xena, this check is
done using a new method called "quota_limit_check" [2]. This method
does not fail in the related case.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/q/I0a9b91b09d6260ff96fdba2f0a455de53bbc1f00
[2]https://review.opendev.org/q/Id73368576a948f78a043d7cf0be16661a65626a9

Closes-Bug: #1992161
Related-Bug: #1858680
Change-Id: I0f20b17c1b13c3cf56de70588fca4a6956d276df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/35/864435/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_security_group_no_quota(self): with mock.patch.object(self.mixin, '_registry_notify'): self.mock_quota_make_res.return_value = None self.mixin.create_security_group(self.ctx, FAKE_SECGROUP) self.mock_quota_commit_res.assert_not_called() self.mock_quota_make_res.return_value = mock.Mock( reservation_id='res_id') self.mixin.create_security_group(self.ctx, FAKE_SECGROUP) self.mock_quota_commit_res.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'res_id')

commit_message:
HAProxy: Remove usage of non-existing haproxy-systemd-wrapper

The wrapper script is no longer provided by the haproxy package since
CentOS 8.

Change-Id: Ied5a564a3156d9f4769b6a6a75480301f0b3665a

deleted_lines: # HAProxy 1.8 doesn't ship haproxy-systemd-wrapper, we have # to use a new dedicated option for live config reload. # Note: we can't use quotes in kolla command, hence the workaround command: bash -c $* -- eval if [ -f /usr/sbin/haproxy-systemd-wrapper ]; then exec /usr/sbin/haproxy-systemd-wrapper -f /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg; else exec /usr/sbin/haproxy -f /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg -Ws; fi

commit_message:
sshd: Strictly validate value for PasswordAuthentication

The PasswordAuthentication parameter accepts only 'yes' or 'no'. This
change introduces more strict validation to ensure the correct value
is passed. In case a wrong value like 'False' is passed, sshd daemon
does not start up correctly.

Change-Id: Ie00de43d86518147c8bd70dcab0925af1c7d7dbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/34/856234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: constraints: - allowed_values: ['yes', 'no']

commit_message:
Modify IPA install and usage for multi-env

Remove auto-reverse from IPA server install as
this option is causing errors in environments
where the zone being created already exists and
is owned by some other dns server.
See related change in:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/737058/.

This patch also stops the unbound service if it
is running on the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ie46809379e5c143910560b4d3f7cb0eee6f80ea1

commit_message:
Added some train2wallaby needed parameters

On the FFU freom train to wallaby there are a couple of missings parameters
that are needed. Otherwise nova wont work.

This change uses:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/829711

Change-Id: I687629530d1e342dd7f3c8e77334206101305503

commit_message:
Drop python2 from bindep.txt

IPA dropped support for Python2 long ago,
and now Python2 is not even available in newer distros,
breaking installation if IPA binary dependencies.

Change-Id: I75a618f94de58f6de2bd96b37de1894bb0e61998
(cherry picked from commit d8a6bf5f61eb1365294c6c07840286f46c9535fc)

commit_message:
Update CHAIR.rst for few updates

It removes the release naming task which is not handled
by TC members anymore. Also add the task to select the
election liaison at the start of cycle.

Change-Id: I584cd5227723759da5325d8015b4fa2f29912cdc

commit_message:
Reconfigure amphora network interfaces seamlessly

Update amphora-interface app to allow reconfiguration of the network
interfaces without having to set them down first.

IP addresses/routes maintained by keepalived in Active/Standby topology
are now explicitly defined and marked as 'ignored' in the interface
files, allowing amphora-interface to not consider them as unused
addresses.

Add fixed_ips support on the VIP port, enabling the possibility to set
up many ip addresses on the VIP port

Story: 2005608
Task: 30847

Change-Id: If0b211b3ef4fce3b7a58823fc8d1e48448e4d346
(cherry picked from commit 7118e8d56f76a99f19fd0696be3f09b6fb258cb2)

commit_message:
Fix barbican client with application credentials/trusts

It seems that keystoneauth1.identity.generic.token doesn't handle
properly the application credential/trust tokens passed by the context
of the requests. When using app credentials, Octavia failed to retrieve
the certificates from barbican.
Switching to keystoneauth1.token_endpoint fixes the issue, the
auth tokens are correctly passed to the barbican client.

Story: 2007619
Task: 39737

Change-Id: Id77ce36f59b71d309f153e5c1d44059f162ee440
(cherry picked from commit ce7f27e3b7ef6a94501ce975fb0e9dadcffb822b)
(cherry picked from commit 851510f4c74658b128790da1aab410e245355a90)

commit_message:
Switch bifrost to use the dnsmasq DHCP driver

Enable the dnsmasq DHCP provider by default, so it is tested in all
jobs except bifrost-integration-dhcp-ubuntu-focal and
bifrost-integration-dhcp-centos-9, which use the "none" provider and
the old static dnsmasq.conf.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/851681
Change-Id: I3a41541ededb647a45f91cb17aff1c6c9b84ab41
Story: 2010203
Task: 45923

commit_message:
READ only database coherency fix

 The document mentionned that we could use
 the rest of nodes as read only nodes, however the
 configuration suggest to use only one.

commit_message:
Cleanup old resize instances dir before resize

If there is a failed resize that also failed the cleanup
process performed by _cleanup_remote_migration() the retry
of the resize will fail because it cannot rename the current
instances directory to _resize.

This renames the _cleanup_failed_migration() that does the
same logic we want to _cleanup_failed_instance_base() and
uses it for both migration and resize cleanup of directory.

It then simply calls _cleanup_failed_instances_base() with
the resize dir path before trying a resize.

Closes-Bug: 1960230
Change-Id: I7412b16be310632da59a6139df9f0913281b5d77
(cherry picked from commit 9111b99f739d41c092db8d01712a5aa72388b5fb)
(cherry picked from commit 31179f62f1c832e0e894d04e9c9dd59978577cc0)

subject: Ironic - Don't query the API for instance counts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-02-16 22:43:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/07f4910c2540dfc611e092b88ca58b50977d2f10', 'message': "Ironic - Don't query the API for instance counts

The compute manager, as part of power state sync, requests
a count of the number of instances from the virt driver. By default
this is done using a helper method which enourages drivers (although
no drivers have done so until now) to implement the method in more
efficent driver aware way.

Generally this was working for smaller deployments which mapped one
nova-compute service to their entire ironic deployment.

However such a configuration only really works for small scale use,
and most operators who use scaled ironic enviroments do so with
thousands or tens of thousands of bare metal nodes.

This *also* would previously query ironic's API for a list of instances
known by ironic, but would be unaware of conductor groups, which would
introduce a continious stream of misscount warnings in the compute
service log for any scaled deployment.

This change moves us to using the internal cache managed by the driver
which represents the known state of the deployment to the nova-compute
service, which *is* conductor group filtered.

With I4b6359c1154a8cecc72c16dddf66c5c4184a69f0, that cache should
also closely represent the running state *and* layout of the deployment
as it evolves. In other words, if conductors are added, or removed, in
time that count should self correct to match up with the hash ring and
the instance records host field.

Ultimately, this addresses both a performance issue, and should remedy
the reported erronious logging issue.

Change-Id: I5dfa8d13d5df1160b4ff1f0c581e6be7cf919f28
Closes-Bug: #1933955

commit_message:
Ironic - Don't query the API for instance counts

The compute manager, as part of power state sync, requests
a count of the number of instances from the virt driver. By default
this is done using a helper method which enourages drivers (although
no drivers have done so until now) to implement the method in more
efficent driver aware way.

Generally this was working for smaller deployments which mapped one
nova-compute service to their entire ironic deployment.

However such a configuration only really works for small scale use,
and most operators who use scaled ironic enviroments do so with
thousands or tens of thousands of bare metal nodes.

This *also* would previously query ironic's API for a list of instances
known by ironic, but would be unaware of conductor groups, which would
introduce a continious stream of misscount warnings in the compute
service log for any scaled deployment.

This change moves us to using the internal cache managed by the driver
which represents the known state of the deployment to the nova-compute
service, which *is* conductor group filtered.

With I4b6359c1154a8cecc72c16dddf66c5c4184a69f0, that cache should
also closely represent the running state *and* layout of the deployment
as it evolves. In other words, if conductors are added, or removed, in
time that count should self correct to match up with the hash ring and
the instance records host field.

Ultimately, this addresses both a performance issue, and should remedy
the reported erronious logging issue.

Change-Id: I5dfa8d13d5df1160b4ff1f0c581e6be7cf919f28
Closes-Bug: #1933955
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/829613/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an inefficent instance count operation when using the ``ironic`` virt driver which is triggered by the power state synchronization in the ``nova-compute`` service. The query now uses the node cache which is aware of the state of the configuration and instances managed by this ``nova-compute`` service.

commit_message:
Update package name in devstack for ubuntu/jammy

For python3, `python-nose` has been changed to `python3-nose` in Ubuntu
Jammy Jellyfish. This change is to update the package name to avoid an
error on exit.

Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4c21b6527f37918397f7fb425075eb6c07534237

commit_message:
Remove the periodic Centos 8 job

Centos 9 fips tests are already merged on Nova and Centos 8 jobs were already replaced by Centos 9,
this patch will delete a Centos 8 periodic pipeline that should have been deleted on previous patcc.

Change-Id: Ib735e9b52915639006bb08424d83f8ee39113d4f
(cherry picked from commit 6aea9f37721aa36d16af49041ddf76e16c45e67c)

commit_message:
Added backoffLimit control for nova-bootstrap job

This PS adds backoffLimit to nova-bootstrap job in nova chart. By default, this job was created from a template in helm-toolkit.

https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm/commit/58291db1a6feb46da6230e7668a180f270f79e28

In this commit the job was re-designed without controlling of the backoffLimit value.

Change-Id: Icb28363be8063d849fd22e9c2542edf1eb203d60
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/92/864592/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
DataCore: Add note about unique CHAP storage paths

If deploying multiple DataCore backends on the same
host, each needs a different datacore_iscsi_chap_storage
path configured, to avoid colliding with each other.

Change-Id: I0655828e04b7445ba2dbfe77d30b461a0ece651e

commit_message:
Set backup status to error on VolumeNotFound

When creating a backup and it fails we will try
to update the status on the volume but if it does
not exist we will instead fail on that and the
backup will be stuck in creating status which means
cloud admin need to help resetting the status.

This catches the VolumeNotFound exception and ignores
updating the volume status and thus backup will be
set to error and can be deleted by user instead.

Closes-Bug: #1996049
Change-Id: Iafa92ece7f83323af257c1702df5029469b11739
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/00/864100/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove ansible-pacemaker from overcloud image

The ansible-pacemaker module was added into the overcloud image at a
time we executed Ansible locally on the overcloud hosts. Now that
Ansible is executed from the undercloud, we only need such modules
installed on the undercloud.

This reverts commit 60f12230aa89d64bd62ed092806f710e1b90cb28.

Change-Id: Ie52f46370604bcf2e18bc7a3c9467fea4602c83b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/39/863639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove workspace from artcl_exclude_list to keep hash_info.sh

We kept the match to collect hash_info at [1] but we added
the entire directory to the exclude list in [2]. This
should let us collect hash_info.sh needed for debug (currently
for mixed OS jobs).

Change-Id: Icfd698f2d820b84d605257fb92e2711d77c7ab83

commit_message:
Hold Weekly Meetings in IRC

Change-Id: Icfd698f2d820b84d605257fb92e2711d77c7ab83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/85/863685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ====================================== 2021-11-03 Hold weekly meetings in IRC ====================================== In a previous resolution titled 2020-08-31 Reinstate Weekly meetings, the Technical Committee (TC) voted to reinstate weekly meetings. These meetings have proved useful in keeping tabs on recurring status issues and allowing the TC to discuss issues with a reliable cadence. Currently, the TC holds one meeting out of four monthly in a video chat. Video chats can allow a lower barrier to participation for able-bodied, English speaking TC members and constituents. There is a significant downside to a video meeting: the quality of text logs from the meeting are traditionally poor and as a result, the discussions, and subsequent votes, that take place during video meetings are not as transparent as a fully logged, text based format. The TC has mitigated this somewhat by putting up a video recording of the meeting on YouTube, and taking minimal notes during video meetings in IRC but these are not a substitute for searchable, detailed IRC logs and minutes. In an effort to increase transparency and accessibility of all TC official business, we should resolve to no longer perform official business in non-written formats. An interested party should be able to read the meeting agenda, minutes, and logs and be able to understand the decisions made and why they were made. This written record supports our values of having Open Design and an Open Community. However, in order to continue serving the needs of our constituents who prefer video formats, we should add a monthly video office hours with no set agenda. This time can be used for TC members to socialize with each others and anyone invested in OpenStack who would like to join. Resolution ---------- All official TC meetings shall be held in an accessible, logged, text-based formats, such as IRC/Matrix chat. Reinstate a monthly Office Hours video hangout for TC members and constituents who prefer that format for fast synchronous communication and context building. At no time shall this be a business meeting where decisions are made by the TC. Meetings that are held in person should include a note taking observer, who is not a member of the TC, to notes and provide a written summary of the meeting to ensure equal access to the information discussed.

commit_message:
Allows configuring unified quotas in nova

Adding ``NovaEnableUnifiedQuotas`` parameter to configure unified
quotas in nova.

To make nova unified quotas work, ``oslo_limit/endpoint_id`` needs
to be set in nova.conf, hence adding the ``NovaKeystoneEndpointId``
for the same.

NOTE: The service's endpoint id registered in Keystone will obviously
be not availalbe until the service is up, hence without unified quotas
the correct endpoint id needs to be find first once overcloud is deployed
and then respective THT parameter could be set by enabling unified quotas.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/864196
Change-Id: Ie4c9d3f1c24bac1e4a9f9c21f3ff6b35298028e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/97/864197/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Added ``NovaEnableUnifiedQuotas`` parameter, which allows Nova to retrieve limits set in Keystone for resource consumption and enforce those against API users. Also added ``NovaKeystoneEndpointId`` to set ``oslo_limit/endpoint_id``, the nova service's endpoint id which is registered in Keystone.

commit_message:
Fix ironic interface option for ironic-inspector

The correct option to use is valid_interfaces [1], not os_endpoint_type.
The os_endpoint_type option was removed in Train.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/wallaby/configuration/sample-config.html

Change-Id: I3906d7b9a2bebfe5c323cba5f80add3e932468c8

commit_message:
Include the required nova::limit class for unified quotas

Incluing nova::limit for enabling unified quotas in nova. Also
nova::limit class requires nova endpoint_id and password parameters,
so these parameters are also added in hieradata with their default
value set to 'None'.

Change-Id: I1c323c062f621c5db67445af787f2af98c9ff3cf

commit_message:
Improved way of detecting Galera cluster is up&running

There is a script in every node that checks correctly if the
Galera node has been correctly re-introduced in the cluster
as the previous check on the local port open had some
disadvantages, and does not wait for IST to complete.

This is an unclean cherry-pick because master have a couple of
conditionals that do not exist on wallaby.

Change-Id: Id49274f5bade4af5b88b6354cfa092e4b041eb6e

commit_message:
Cleanup old resize instances dir before resize

If there is a failed resize that also failed the cleanup
process performed by _cleanup_remote_migration() the retry
of the resize will fail because it cannot rename the current
instances directory to _resize.

This renames the _cleanup_failed_migration() that does the
same logic we want to _cleanup_failed_instance_base() and
uses it for both migration and resize cleanup of directory.

It then simply calls _cleanup_failed_instances_base() with
the resize dir path before trying a resize.

Conflicts:

- nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
  There is no need to mock
  nova.virt.libvirt.utils.save_and_migrate_vtpm_dir
  in stable/ussuri.

Closes-Bug: 1960230
Change-Id: I7412b16be310632da59a6139df9f0913281b5d77
(cherry picked from commit 9111b99f739d41c092db8d01712a5aa72388b5fb)

commit_message:
Added "qos" plugin to "EXT_PARENT_RESOURCE_MAPPING"

The plugin "qos" is added to the "EXT_PARENT_RESOURCE_MAPPING" constant.
The policy engine can now check the QoS rule ownership using the QoS
policy project ID. The QoS rules are resources that do not have an
assigned project ID, it is inherited from the QoS policy. This patch
allows to check a QoS rule ownership using the "ext_parent_policy_id"
field, that stores the QoS policy project ID.

NOTE: once released, this bug fix must include Neutron unit tests
checking, using the rules:
  "update_policy_bandwidth_limit_rule": "rule:admin_or_owner"
  "update_policy_packet_rate_limit_rule": "rule:admin_or_owner"
  "update_policy_dscp_marking_rule": "rule:admin_or_owner"
  "update_policy_minimum_bandwidth_rule": "rule:admin_or_owner"
  "update_policy_minimum_packet_rate_rule": "rule:admin_or_owner"

Closes-Bug: #1996606
Change-Id: I0531ea2c1bf29aecfab9b491eefef044a4ee49ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/68/864568/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add automatic snapshots creation/deletion policies.

Change-Id: Id7c30278dfcebcd65993072e0f5e3a732ac9a620
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-specs refs/changes/65/823165/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================== Automatic snapshots =================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/manila/+spec/automatic-snapshots To add automatic snapshot policy and automatic snapshot deletion policy for a share. Problem description =================== Manila needs a way to support automatic snapshots of a share. The time interval after which new snapshot should be created is defined by per share automatic snapshot policy and is given in cron format during either share creation or share update. Similarly if automatic snapshots are enabled, user should have an option to create automatic snapshot deletion policy. In this policy as well, time interval for deletion is given in cron format during either share creation or share update. Use Cases ========= For high availability and recovery, user can enable this feature. It would be then possible to create share from snapshot. User can accordingly set both automatic-snapshot-policy and automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy. Proposed change =============== Add two new options to share create as well as share update command i.e. --automatic-snapshot-policy and --automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy. --automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy is valid only of --automatic-snapshot-policy is set. e.g. `--automatic-snapshot-policy 0 * * * *` will specify that snapshots should be created for every hour at the beginning of the hour. `--automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy 0 0 * * *` will specify that snapshots should be deleted for once a day at midnight. For handling automatic snapshot creation and deletion, periodic tasks will be created during share create. The provided input values for both policies will also be stored in share admin-only metadata. In addition, if snapshot policies are not given during share creation, user have an option to create them during share update command. However, if snapshot policies are already present for given share, existing policies will be updated to new policies specificed in share update command. This means, existing periodic tasks will be killed and new periodic tasks will be created. The existing metadata will also be updated. During share delete, if automatic snapshots are not deleted e.g. deletion periodic task is not executed yet, it would be user/admin-s responsibilty to manually delete all snapshots and then delete share. We also need to set "automatic_snapshot_for_replicas_enabled" config option to True in order to consider share replicas for automatic snapshots otherwise automatic snapshots are only applicable to share. This is global config option and thus will be applicable for all shares. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None. The policiess will be saved as additional share metadata. REST API impact --------------- Parameter 'automatic-snapshot-policy' and 'automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy' added to share create and share update, for example:: `{ "share": { "automatic-snapshot-policy": "cron_format_1" "automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy": "crom_format_2" } }` In this particular example, the share snapshots should be taken as per time interval defined in cron_fomat_1 and share snapshots should be deleted as per periodic time interval defined in cron_format_2. All given cron_formats will be validated against valid values and share creation will fail if at least one of the value is malformed. The semantics for "automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy" is must defined "automatic-snapshot-policy", meaning that the share won't get created, if only "automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy" specified. Microversion of the API is incremented. Security impact --------------- Although this change involves using or parsing user-provided snapshot policies. This doesn't put Manila in any more danger as it is now. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ This feature would query DB once per execution of periodic task, it only adds slightly latency to the system and the latency has nothing to do with the size of the system. The share metadata update might take extra time, especially when many shares are specified with snapshot policies. Yet share creation or deletion is an async process and this impact should not be noticeable by the end user. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Manish Honap (mhonap in Gerrit) Kiran Pawar (kpdev in Gerrit) Work Items ---------- 1. Periodic tasks implementation 2. Add snapshot policy parameters 3. Add policy arguments for python-manilaclient 4. Add policy support in manila-ui Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Test against automatic-snapshot-policy: * Create share with periodic snapshot policy set to 15 seconds; * After 20 seconds, checks if snapshot is taken; Test against automatic-snapshot-deletion-policy: * Create share with periodic snapshot of 15 seconds and periodic snapshot deletion of 35 seconds; * After 20 seconds, checks if share snapshot is taken; * After 40 seconds, checks if all snapshots are deleted; Documentation Impact ==================== Need to document the usage of automatic snasphot policies. References ========== None

commit_message:
Enable --retain option for zebra daemon

Using the retain option when starting zebra allows operators to
not lose routes installed by zebra from the kernel when stopping
frr/zebra.

Change-Id: Ie4936401c8567204029a493e5d3b77d1ce7cc5a6
(cherry picked from commit 68f4fde4efcc4658ce54b3f18be751df3354743e)

commit_message:
Release ovsdbapp for Antelope-1 milestone

This is a library release for ovsdbapp for the Antelope-1
milestone. This repository contains commits that have not been releases
for this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.1.0..5f429b7
5f429b7 Use daemon property instead of setDaemon method
cd70d1e Don't force_reconnect() on unhandled Idl exception
75d690d Fix logging exception while handling transaction exception
44756a4 Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name
bd62385 Update master for stable/zed
c3bacb3 Fix TRY_AGAIN handling

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifb0e7fa2ff749e22bfe582c0bf3f94a8fc914aa9

commit_message:
[stable-only] Add "tempest-integrated-networking" job to experimental

Added "tempest-integrated-networking" job to experimental queue. This
patch is inline with [1]. During the October 2022 PTG was approved the
addition of this new job to the check and gate queues.

In order to increase the coverage in the stable releases too, this job
is also added to the experimental queue in the stable releases. It
could be useful for some specific backports.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/861948

Change-Id: Iaf29998bc203ec46fd42c7e8decb26b6c3bb7312

commit_message:
Update URL for flake8 from Gitlab to Github

It seems flake8 project has been migrated from Gitlab and Github and it
is no longer available in Gitlab. This change updates the URL in
the doc to direct readers to the new repository.

Change-Id: Ia9e8429e8d32a181a47aee43ebde5378c6ac9cf0

commit_message:
mlnx: Remove deprecated duplicate parameters

This change removes the two parameters of networking-mlnx-agent, which
were deprecated by [1] during the Zed cycle, in favor of the duplicate
parameters in the different common classes.

[1] f7b4c844bc95056d8a242332bcf60fcb5b49d8f5

Change-Id: I00cedb7a4a41333a6793d2358e64aa1ac4797fa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/50/864450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | The following parameters of the ``neutron::agents::ml2::mlnx`` class have been removed. - ``dhcp_broadcast_reply`` - ``interface_driver``

no effect since then.

[1] eb3361bc9981a6e3a50bc9ac9ec53f76bf140743

commit_message:
image: Add 'image stage' command

This is the equivalent of the 'image-stage' glanceclient command.

Change-Id: I10b01ef145740a2f7ffe5a8c7ce0296df0ece0bd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

added_lines: class StageImage(command.Command): _description = _( "Upload data for a specific image to staging.\n" "This requires support for the interoperable image import process, " "which was first introduced in Image API version 2.6 " "(Glance 16.0.0 (Queens))" ) def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super().get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( '--file', metavar='<file>', dest='filename', help=_( 'Local file that contains disk image to be uploaded. ' 'Alternatively, images can be passed via stdin.' ), ) # NOTE(stephenfin): glanceclient had a --size argument but it didn't do # anything so we have chosen not to port this parser.add_argument( '--progress', action='store_true', default=False, help=_( 'Show upload progress bar ' '(ignored if passing data via stdin)' ), ) parser.add_argument( 'image', metavar='<image>', help=_('Image to upload data for (name or ID)'), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): image_client = self.app.client_manager.image image = image_client.find_image( parsed_args.image, ignore_missing=False, ) # open the file first to ensure any failures are handled before the # image is created. Get the file name (if it is file, and not stdin) # for easier further handling. if parsed_args.filename: try: fp = open(parsed_args.filename, 'rb') except FileNotFoundError: raise exceptions.CommandError( '%r is not a valid file' % parsed_args.filename, ) else: fp = get_data_from_stdin() kwargs = {} if parsed_args.progress and parsed_args.filename: # NOTE(stephenfin): we only show a progress bar if the user # requested it *and* we're reading from a file (not stdin) filesize = os.path.getsize(parsed_args.filename) if filesize is not None: kwargs['data'] = progressbar.VerboseFileWrapper(fp, filesize) else: kwargs['data'] = fp elif parsed_args.filename: kwargs['filename'] = parsed_args.filename elif fp: kwargs['data'] = fp image_client.stage_image(image, **kwargs)

added_lines: def get_data_from_stdin(): # distinguish cases where: # (1) stdin is not valid (as in cron jobs): # openstack ... <&- # (2) image data is provided through stdin: # openstack ... < /tmp/file # (3) no image data provided # openstack ... try: os.fstat(0) except OSError: # (1) stdin is not valid return None if not sys.stdin.isatty(): # (2) image data is provided through stdin image = sys.stdin if hasattr(sys.stdin, 'buffer'): image = sys.stdin.buffer if msvcrt: msvcrt.setmode(sys.stdin.fileno(), os.O_BINARY) return image else: # (3) return None dest="filename", help=_( "Show upload progress bar " "(ignored if passing data via stdin)" ), if parsed_args.filename: try: fp = open(parsed_args.filename, 'rb') except FileNotFoundError: raise exceptions.CommandError( '%r is not a valid file' % parsed_args.filename, ) else: fp = get_data_from_stdin() if parsed_args.progress and parsed_args.filename: filesize = os.path.getsize(parsed_args.filename) else: kwargs['data'] = fp elif parsed_args.filename: kwargs['filename'] = parsed_args.filename if not parsed_args.filename: if parsed_args.filename: fp.close() dest="filename", output_file = parsed_args.filename
deleted_lines: def get_data_file(args): if args.file: return (open(args.file, 'rb'), args.file) else: # distinguish cases where: # (1) stdin is not valid (as in cron jobs): # openstack ... <&- # (2) image data is provided through stdin: # openstack ... < /tmp/file # (3) no image data provided # openstack ... try: os.fstat(0) except OSError: # (1) stdin is not valid return (None, None) if not sys.stdin.isatty(): # (2) image data is provided through stdin image = sys.stdin if hasattr(sys.stdin, 'buffer'): image = sys.stdin.buffer if msvcrt: msvcrt.setmode(sys.stdin.fileno(), os.O_BINARY) return (image, None) else: # (3) return (None, None) help=_("Show upload progress bar."), fp, fname = get_data_file(parsed_args) if fp is None and parsed_args.file: LOG.warning(_("Failed to get an image file.")) return {}, {} if parsed_args.progress and parsed_args.file: filesize = os.path.getsize(fname) elif fname: kwargs['filename'] = fname if not parsed_args.file: output_file = parsed_args.file

commit_message:
Pull flake8 from Github

It seems flake8 is no longer available in Gitlab. This change switches
the source from Gitlab to Github to avoid the following failure.

fatal: could not read Username for 'https://gitlab.com': No such device
or address

Closes-Bug: #1996668
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/864603
Change-Id: I0a30b9ae7ccc2d5faf67e78c1f2d04cea446cecc

commit_message:
image: Ignore '--progress' if providing image data from stdin

You can provide data via stdin when creating an image. Using this with
'--progress' makes no sense and causes an error currently. Fix this.

Change-Id: I3c2d658b72a7c62931b779b0d19bb97f60a0c655
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
